â
'''K-Meleon''' is a [[web browser]] for the [[Microsoft Windows]] platform. Based on the same [[Gecko (layout engine)|Gecko]] [[layout engine]] as [[Mozilla Firefox]], K-Meleon uses native Windows [[Application programming interface|API]] to create the [[user interface]] (instead of using Mozilla's cross-platform [[XUL]] layer), and as a result, is tightly integrated into the look and feel of the Windows desktop;<ref>http://www.oss-watch.ac.uk/resources/webbrowser.xml#body.1_div.5 "Open source and the web browser" by Elena Blanco, [[OSS Watch]]</ref> this approach is similar to that of [[Galeon]] and [[Epiphany (web browser)|Epiphany]] (for the [[GNOME]] desktop), and [[Camino]] (for [[Mac OS X]]). This also makes K-Meleon less resource-intensive and more responsive to user input.
+
'''K-Meleon''' is a [[web browser]] for the [[Microsoft Windows]] platform. Based on the same [[Gecko (layout engine)|Gecko]] [[layout engine]] as [[Mozilla Firefox]], K-Meleon uses native Windows [[Application programming interface|API]] to create the [[user interface]] (instead of using Mozilla's cross-platform [[XUL]] layer), and as a result, is tightly integrated into the look and feel of the Windows desktop;<ref>http://www.oss-watch.ac.uk/resources/webbrowser.xml#body.1_div.5 "Open source and the web browser" by Elena Blanco, [[OSS Watch]]</ref> this approach is similar to that of [[Galeon]] and [[Epiphany (web browser)|Epiphany]] (for the [[GNOME]] desktop), and [[Camino]] (for [[Mac OS X]]). This also makes K-Meleon less resource-intensive and more responsive to user input.{{fact}}
